attributes.action: All HGV CPC courses to be online only.
attributes.additional_details: A hgv driver has to sit in a classroom once a year for eight grueling hours and usually in their leisure time or time when they should be relaxing. However, information on one subject can be taught within a few hours and is dragged out to eight hours to suite vosa.  5 modules to learn such as first aid could have been chosen every year which made the scheme a debarcle.  Now we have a dangerous situation with covid, I think all courses should be online only, to be learnt at the drivers discretion.
attributes.background: Stop HGV CPC courses in classrooms.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about how to provide CPC training courses are a matter for individual course providers, not the Government or House of Commons, and some course providers already offer online CPC modules.
